alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:58AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Monroe County through 315 AM CDT... At 258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bedford to near West Point. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aberdeen, Gattman, Binford, East Aberdeen, Sipsey Fork, New Hamilton, Quincy, Muldon, Greenwood Springs, Wise Gap, Athens and Strong. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern Mississippi.
